meanings.definition: The lowest point or part of something.
meanings.sent1: The bottoming of the staircase was dark and dusty.
meanings.sent2: I found a spider hiding in the bottoming of the box.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to nap in the cozy bottoming of the closet.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits hit rock bottoming when she lost the competition.
meanings.sent5: The bottoming of the well seemed to go on forever.

meanings.definition: The act of reaching the lowest point or level.
meanings.sent1: The bottoming of the rollercoaster made my stomach drop.
meanings.sent2: After hours of hiking, they finally reached the bottoming of the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The bottoming of the sales chart was not a cause for celebration.
meanings.sent4: His mood took a dive to the bottoming after the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The bottoming of the ocean is a mysterious and unexplored place.

meanings.definition: The act of submitting or yielding to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her bottoming to her boss's demands cost her happiness.
meanings.sent2: The bottoming to peer pressure led him to make a poor decision.
meanings.sent3: The bottoming to the temptation of chocolate cake was too strong.
meanings.sent4: His bottoming to authority figures was both his strength and weakness.
meanings.sent5: The bottoming to tradition kept the ceremony meaningful and special.
